logisticreg 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Logistic Regression Analysis Using Numerical Optimization

    logistic_regression_analysis.Rd

    Fits a logistic regression model to a binary response, computes bootstrap confidence intervals, and provides predictions and performance metrics.

    logistic_regression_analysis(data, x_vars, y_var, no_of_bootstraps)

    Arguments

    data

    A data frame containing predictors and response.

    x_vars

    Character vector of predictor variable names.

    y_var

    Character string of the binary response variable name.

    no_of_bootstraps

    Integer number of bootstrap samples for confidence intervals.

    Value

    A list with:

    beta

    Estimated coefficients (including intercept).

    bootstrap_conf_int

    Confidence intervals for coefficients.

    predicted_probabilities

    Predicted probabilities.

    predictions

    Predicted classes (0/1).

    confusion_matrix_metrics

    Performance metrics and confusion matrix.

    Details

    This function:

    • Removes rows with missing values.

    • Converts character predictors to factors and creates dummy variables.

    • Ensures the response is binary (0/1).

    • Uses optim() for logistic regression.

    • Uses a fixed \(\alpha=0.05\) and cutoff = 0.5.

    Examples

    n <- 100
X_mat <- matrix(rnorm(n * 2), ncol = 2)  
y <- rbinom(n, 1, prob = 0.5) 

data <- data.frame(y = y,x1 = X_mat[, 1],x2 = X_mat[, 2])
x_vars <- c("x1", "x2")
y_var <- "y"
results <- logistic_regression_analysis(data = data,x_vars = x_vars,y_var = y_var,no_of_bootstraps = 20)
#> Estimated Coefficients:
#>                    [,1]
#> (Intercept)  0.09085143
#> x1          -0.06529886
#> x2           0.19116387
#> attr(,"names")
#> [1] "(Intercept)" "x1"          "x2"         
#> 
#> Bootstrap Confidence Intervals:
#> $lower
#> [1] -0.2441237 -0.2148316 -0.2706404
#> 
#> $upper
#> [1] 0.4224151 0.2921448 0.4813866
#> 
#>

#> 1 0.5124352
#> 2 0.4571192
#> 3 0.4353999
#> 4 0.4928154
#> 5 0.5326352
#> 6 0.5831376

#> 1    1
#> 2    0
